Overreaching.origin: [claimed that by the prosecution barred a retrial because of double jeopardy]

1.definition: conduct that exceeds established limits (as of authority or due process) [claimed that by the prosecution barred a retrial because of double jeopardy]

2.definition: the gaining of an unconscionable advantage over another esp. by unfair or deceptive means [if the contract was void for traditional reasons such as fraud or ", 636 So. 2d 1332 (1994)"]
